xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:title: XCCDF Benchmark That References the Validation Content for the passwordpolicy_test
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:description: This XCCDF Benchmark references the OVAL Defintitions in the validation content for the passwordpolicy_test.

xccdf:Profile.xccdf:title: XCCDF Profile That References the Validation Content for the passwordpolicy_test

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Test the min_passwd_len entity with the greater than operation
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Make sure the min_passwd_len entity properly supports the greater than operation.

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_len entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_len entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_len is greater than 0.

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_len entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_len entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_len equals 9.

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_len entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_len entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_len is less than 14 (PWLEN).

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_len entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_len entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_len is greater than or equal to 9.

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_len entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_len entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_len is less than or equal to 9.

metadata.title: Test the max_passwd_age entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the max_passwd_age entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the max_passwd_age is greater than 0.

metadata.title: Test the max_passwd_age entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the max_passwd_age entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the max_passwd_age equals 23 days (1987200 seconds).

metadata.title: Test the max_passwd_age entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the max_passwd_age entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the max_passwd_age is less than 4294967295 (TIMEQ_FOREVER).

metadata.title: Test the max_passwd_age entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the max_passwd_age entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the max_passwd_age is greater than or equal to 23 days (1987200 seconds).

metadata.title: Test the max_passwd_age entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the max_passwd_age entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the max_passwd_age is less than or equal to 23 days (1987200 seconds).

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_age entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_age entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_age is greater than 0.

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_age entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_age entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_age equals 5 days (432000 seconds).

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_age entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_age entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_age is less than 4294967295 (TIMEQ_FOREVER).

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_age entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_age entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_age is greater than or equal to 5 days (432000 seconds).

metadata.title: Test the min_passwd_age entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the min_passwd_age entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_age is less than or equal to 5 days (432000 seconds).

metadata.title: Test the password_hist_len entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the password_hist_len entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the password_hist_len is greater than 0.

metadata.title: Test the password_hist_len entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the password_hist_len entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the password_hist_len equals 17.

metadata.title: Test the password_hist_len entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the password_hist_len entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the password_hist_len is less than 24.

metadata.title: Test the password_hist_len entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the password_hist_len entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the password_hist_len is greater than or equal to 17.

metadata.title: Test the password_hist_len entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the password_hist_len entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the password_hist_len is less than or equal to 17.

metadata.title: Test the extend_definition construct with the negate property
metadata.description: Make sure the extend_definition construct properly supports the negate property.

extend_definition.comment: Test the negate property using definition 1

passwordpolicy_test.comment: Test to see that the min_passwd_len is greater than 0.
Test to see that the min_passwd_len equals 9.
Test to see that the min_passwd_len is less than 14 (PWLEN).
Test to see that the min_passwd_len is greater than or equal to 9.
Test to see that the min_passwd_len is less than or equal to 9.
Test to see that the max_passwd_age is greater than 0.
Test to see that the max_passwd_age equals 23 days (1987200 seconds).
Test to see that the max_passwd_age is less than 4294967295 (TIMEQ_FOREVER).
Test to see that the max_passwd_age is greater than or equal to 23 days (1987200 seconds).
Test to see that the max_passwd_age is less than or equal to 23 days (1987200 seconds).
Test to see that the min_passwd_age is greater than 0.
Test to see that the min_passwd_age equals 5 days (432000 seconds).
Test to see that the min_passwd_age is less than 4294967295 (TIMEQ_FOREVER).
Test to see that the min_passwd_age is greater than or equal to 5 days (432000 seconds).
Test to see that the min_passwd_age is less than or equal to 5 days (432000 seconds).
Test to see that the password_hist_len is greater than 0.
Test to see that the password_hist_len equals 17.
Test to see that the password_hist_len is less than 24.
Test to see that the password_hist_len is greater than or equal to 17.
Test to see that the password_hist_len is less than or equal to 17.

generator.oval:product_name: National Institute of Standards and Technology

metadata.title: Microsoft Windows is installed
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Microsoft Windows

criterion.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

family_test.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

family_object.comment: This is the default family object. Only one family object should exist.

notes.note: This CPE Name represents the Windows OS
